text: if you want to know what I eat for
breakfast on any given day the answer is
almost always avocado I love avocado and
I often pair it with eggs so today I'm
sharing an avocado and egg sandwich that
is really easy and a quick breakfast for
you and for me toast a whole wheat
English muffin or a regular English
muffin or pieces of toast whatever you
like slice up a scallion this just
serves one so you can increase the
recipe to serve more if you have more
people eating this breakfast 1/4 of an
avocado I usually eat about a half an
avocado but that seems greedy so 1/4 is
probably fine now that this is all ready
I'm ready to cook the eggs so take your
scallions with you add your scallion and
a little bit of olive oil or butter I
usually cook my eggs and butter but some
people really love the flavor of olive
oil for cooking their eggs and well some
people think it's healthier to eggs if
you want to do one egg and one egg white
for something slightly less caloric go
ahead I never do that so I'm just doing
two whole eggs salt and pepper too much
because it's only from one so I'm ready
when my egg is ready I'm gonna get all
set up with my plate I toasted my
English muffin
get my avocado add the eggs now this is
a scramble slash omelet so I'm emulating
the egg sandwich fold over that we do at
our New York delis let's see how I do
sort of half scramble so now that it's
set on top fold the egg so that it's
about the size of your English muffin
into a little package it's kind of cute
right
look fits right on your muffin
slide it on oh was a little bigger but
that's okay and then your avocado goes
on top dude
so 1/4 of an avocado half an avocado up
to you and then some hot sauce because
no egg dish is complete without hot
sauce so I'm gonna drizzle from the cap
maybe tiny pinch and that's it it's a
breakfast sandwich extraordinaire it
only takes a couple minutes to put
together
so there's no more excuses for not
making a healthy and delicious breakfast
every day
